priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Mode of Disease Transmission Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C127265

self.title: CDISC SDTM Mode of Disease Transmission Terminology

definition: The terminology relevant to the mechanism by which a disease is transmitted.
name: Mode of Disease Transmission
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Mode of Disease Transmission Terminology

terms.definition: The infusion of whole blood or a blood component into the bloodstream.
The nursing of an infant at the female's breast.
The transmission of a disease from one individual to another within the same species.
The use of injection needles that have been previously used.
The exposure to agents that occurs as a result of in utero development.
The process by which a mammal gives birth.
The exposure to agents that occurs as a result of one's occupation.
Sexual contact with a member of the opposite sex.
The exposure to agents that occurs transplacentally or during the labor and delivery process.
Sexual contact with a member of the same sex.
Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused. (NCI)
The transmission of a disease from the mother to the fetus or newborn.
